intro: Psychotria victoriae, commonly known as the Victoria's Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is often found in shaded, humid environments and thrives in the understory of tropical forests. The species is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
